Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 152 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Pausanias. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0194.23.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (210)
